thread.title: Niagara County man arrested for threatening the President
thread.title_full: Niagara County man arrested for threatening the President

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Niagara County man arrested for threatening the President
text:
NIAGARA COUNTY, N.Y. -- A man from Niagara County was arrested for threatening the President. Police officials say in September, 18-year-old, Jared Brown from Niagara County, called the Lockport City Police Department through the 911 Emergency Call Center and made threats over the phone. During the call, Brown threatened to kill President Obama.
Brown also alleges that when a Secret Service Agent asked the hypothetical question what Brown would do if the President walked into the interview room, Brown said he would shoot him.
Brown appeared in court on Wednesday and is due back in court on Oct. 22 at 2:30 p.m.
